div.p:
Botanic Gardens 26/3/67
Written by Ernst Heyne?

One of the boys employed in this establishment (William Lamley jun.) having recently died, I have now the honor to solicit, that you will be pleased to grant me authority to pay the wages due to him for work performed (from the first of March to the 20th 17 days at 3/ per day) to his father Will. Lamley sen., also employed in this establishment, who is the rightful owner, the boy having been under age.

div.p:
The honorable the Chief Secretary
MS annotation: 'Approved J McC 1 April 1867'.
The request form, addressed to the Governor, is attached to this file. The sum of £2.11.0 was approved. The paperwork was forwarded to M annotated: 'the Director of the Botanic Gardens is requested to append a certified copy of the Order in Council to the pay sheet and return the papers. J. Moore 13 […] 1867. M returned the papers: 'Request complied with & best thanks tendered. Ferd. Mueller 17/4/67. [Q67/3869, unit 254, VPRS 3991, PROV.]
